class_notes:
(Same as FREN 341 1)
FREN 341 "Illness Narratives"Bruyère (MW 11:30am-12:45pm, in person)
Content: The objective of this class is to assess illness narratives as genre, archive, and form of self-care. The perspective will be both historical (from early modern anatomy to contemporary cancer culture, from Montaigne to Agnès Varda) and intersectional (touching on issues of gender, disability, and health activism). Taught in English with the possibility to complete written assignments in French.
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to four hours.
